alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:52AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jo Daviess, northwestern Clinton, Linn, southeastern Buchanan, Delaware, southeastern Benton, western Jackson, north central Muscatine, Dubuque, Cedar, Jones and northeastern Johnson Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 352 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Holy Cross to near Fairfax. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could break tree limbs, knock down weak trees and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Dubuque, Maquoketa, Anamosa, Manchester, Galena, Tipton, West Branch, Mechanicsville, Stanwood, Marion, Hiawatha, Mount Vernon, Asbury, Dyersville, Monticello, Robins, Center Point, Cascade and Lisbon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 252 and 267. Interstate 380 between mile markers 7 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
